## Hello Developers ðŸŒ±

Welcome to todayâ€™s post, where weâ€™ll break down a blockchain topic into bite-sized pieces to help you learn and
apply your new skills in the real world.

Todayâ€™s topic is How to quickly build an NFT collection on Celo.

Hereâ€™s a list of what weâ€™ll cover ðŸ—’

- âœ… Step 1: Connect to MetaMask
- âœ… Step 2: Upload your NFT with Pinata
- âœ… Step 3: Create your Smart Contract (low-code)
- âœ… Step 4: Deploy your Smart Contract
- âœ… Step 5: Mint your NFT

By the end of this post, youâ€™ll have an NFT collection built using MetaMask, Celo, Pinata, IPFS, OpenZeppelin,
and Remix. These tools allow you to create, deploy, and manage NFTs quickly without writing any code.

Letâ€™s go! ðŸš€

### Before getting started

This post uses a variety of tools to help you quickly deploy your NFT on Celo. While the post allows you to
follow along with no background in these tools, it may help to review some of the links below.

- [Celo](https://celo.org/)
- [MetaMask](https://metamask.io/)
- [Pinata](https://www.pinata.cloud/)
- [IPFS](https://ipfs.io/)
- [OpenZeppelin](https://www.openzeppelin.com/)
- [Remix](https://remix-project.org/)

### âœ… Step 1: Connect to MetaMask

MetaMask allows you to connect to the Celo blockchain from your browser. To get started, install the
[Metamask](https://metamask.io/) browser extension.

![](https://docs.celo.org/assets/images/1-e86102da8abe0ef3a5ebd02f180c6c3b.png)

- Add Alfajores Testnet to MetaMask using the manual setup option here
- Add CELO to your test account using the [Alfajores Testnet Faucet](https://faucet.celo.org/)

### âœ… Step 2: Upload your NFT â€‹with Pinata

Pinata allows you to easily upload files to [IPFS](https://ipfs.io/) to use as your NFT.

![](https://docs.celo.org/assets/images/2-c0350bea31c782b479235615a1f607f6.png)

To get started, go to [Pinata](https://app.pinata.cloud/) and log in or sign up for an account.

![](https://docs.celo.org/assets/images/3-906b07f8b814d0283b40086204ce82b8.png)

Once logged in, select the ** + Upload ** button

![](https://docs.celo.org/assets/images/4-12519caa4cac3c4049d9425b40f05674.png)

Choose the files you would like to upload and complete the upload process.

![](https://docs.celo.org/assets/images/5-85211fc8fbed0602758bb9ec2c2ddcdc.png)

You should now see the name and content identifier (CID) hash for each file.

![](https://docs.celo.org/assets/images/6-c90dfbf5ed1ffb3700955d9de6ee955f.png)

Youâ€™ll now prepare the token metadata. The example uses a folder named prosper factory metadata. View the
contents of the folder [here](https://gateway.pinata.cloud/ipfs/QmdmA3gwGukA8QDPH7Ypq1WAoVfX82nx7SaXFvh1T7UmvZ).

![](https://docs.celo.org/assets/images/7-24accfc07a59785b6acfd45af7bda4f1.png)

Select any file to view the NFT metadata from within a browser that supports IPFS (example: Brave Browser) to
see the unique image reference.

    ```javascript
        {
        "image": "ipfs://QmVKCcW7c5aUs3GzW92atgFUz7N6rox7EzeibEbyJ6jBMi"
        }
        ```

Next, create a folder containing metadata for each NFT youâ€™d like to create. Upload a folder containing all of
the token metadata to Pinata. This will make your NFT data publicly available.

![](https://docs.celo.org/assets/images/8-94430204e148aab19a2ebe2da58f2c0c.png)

This example uses a folder name prosper factory metadata. You can view the contents of the folder here. The
folder contains 14 files, numbered 0â€“13. The names of these files are important. These file names correspond to
the token ID of each NFT that will be created by the contract. Make sure that there are no extensions
(.txt, .json, .jpeg, .png) on your files.

### âœ… Step 3: Create your Smart Contract (low-code)â€‹

Now that your NFT image is on IPFS, youâ€™ll create and deploy a smart contract. In this post, youâ€™ll use
OpenZeppelin, a well known smart contract library to create your smart contract without writing any code.

- Start by navigating to the [OpenZeppelin Contracts Wizard](https://docs.openzeppelin.com/contracts/4.x/wizard)

![](https://docs.celo.org/assets/images/9-b09ce428a2ed0cd41b6348205dea49f8.png)

Select ERC721 as your token choice and learn more about ERC721 [here](https://docs.openzeppelin.com/contracts/4.x/erc721).

![](https://docs.celo.org/assets/images/10-9b8ca8a0388ae4b07f4fe7bb74edc19b.png)

- Enter your token information (name, symbol).
- Enter the Content Identifier (CID) from Pinata as the Base URI

![](https://docs.celo.org/assets/images/11-91eb9d27886022f8f629e788f0b4f416.png)

- Select Mintable and Auto increment ids. This gives each NFT a unique identifier that increments as new NFTs are minted.
- Select Ownable. This restricts minting to the owner of the contract. The owner is the address you used to deploy your smart contract.

![](https://docs.celo.org/assets/images/12-8a948dace7f03f79d79a6b50a0bb3620.png)

### âœ… â€‹Step 4: Deploy your Smart Contract

Remix is an online tool that allows you to develop, deploy, and manage smart contracts on Celo. Now that your
contract is complete, youâ€™ll use Remix to interact with your smart contract.

![](https://docs.celo.org/assets/images/13-72875d9f42f11c005e5e27b909d7182c.png)

- From the OpenZeppelin Wizard, click Open in Remix.
- Remix will open with your OpenZeppelin contract available.
- Click the blue button labeled Compile Contract.

![](https://docs.celo.org/assets/images/14-e5af64c1e15870006adc21328341fb2d.png)

After compiling the contract, click the Ethereum logo on the left panel to open the Deploy & Run transactions tab.

![](https://docs.celo.org/assets/images/15-599582826df99f98743c02fb0fd5db1a.png)

- In the Environment dropdown, select Injected Web3 to connect Remix to MetaMask.
- Check that MetaMask is connected to the correct network (example: Alfajores Testnet). This network will appear as Custom (44787).

![](https://docs.celo.org/assets/images/16-da83db2685b8f2a93bce28aa34ae0fc2.png)

Select the contract you would like to deploy (example: ProsperityFactory).

![](data:image/png;base64,)

- Click Deploy and confirm the transaction from MetaMask.
- View your deployed contract from the dropdown on the bottom left corner of Remix.

![](https://docs.celo.org/assets/images/18-f6445cd5023489a1c0d286dc6d21c2c0.png)

Expand the dropdown to see each of your contractâ€™s functions.

### âœ… Step 5: Mint your NFT

Youâ€™re finally ready to mint your NFT!

- Call the safeMint function using your wallet address as the input.
- Confirm the transaction in MetaMask to mint your first NFT.

![](data:image/png;base64,)

You can verify that the token was minted by calling the tokenURI function with the expected token ID. Calling
the contract with tokenURI = 0 will return the NFTs IPFS reference

![](data:image/png;base64,)

This IPFS reference will show the token metadata for that NFT.

#### Example Image

```javascript
{
"image": "ipfs://QmVKCcW7c5aUs3GzW92atgFUz7N6rox7EzeibEbyJ6jBMi"
}
```

Navigate to the IPFS reference to view the image for the token.

![](https://docs.celo.org/assets/images/21-3c9a9080c2258fd44c3b25de8de24b15.png)

### Congratulations ðŸŽ‰

That wraps up todayâ€™s topic on how to quickly build an NFT collection on Celo. You can review each of the items
we covered below and check that youâ€™re ready to apply these new skills.

#### Hereâ€™s a quick review of what we covered ðŸ¤”

- âœ… Step 1: Connect to MetaMask
- âœ… Step 2: Upload your NFT with Pinata
- âœ… Step 3: Create your Smart Contract (low-code)
- âœ… Step 4: Deploy your Smart Contract
- âœ… Step 5: Mint your NFT

&nbsp;

Hopefully, you now have an NFT collection built using MetaMask, Celo, Pinata, IPFS, OpenZeppelin, and Remix. Use
can now use these tools whenever youâ€™d like to create, deploy, and manage NFTs quickly without writing any code.

GN! ðŸ‘‹
